intro: Primula junior, commonly known as the small primrose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that come in a variety of colors, including white, pink, and yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features broad, ovate leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland or meadow habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
